name: KARP DVD
description:
Kill All Redneck Pricks: a documentary film about a band called KARP.

'The story of three friends overcoming odds through rock n' roll music. Set in the Pacific Northwest against the backdrop of the Olympia, WA post punk and Riot girl movements of the early 90's, the film details the joys and tragedies of a band called KARP as each band member's life serves as a lightning bolt to a separate destiny.'

karplives.com

Soundmaker presented the screening of this most awesome documentary at the victoria pub, East London in October 2011. It turned out to be the first time it was screened outside the USA. With director William Badgley taking it on a successful UK/Europe tour.

We are happy to announce that we will be selling a very limited number of the DVD, for postage to UK/Europe at Â£13.99

name: Elephant skull t-shirt
description:
The Kurtz elephant skull logo on a white Gildan heavy tee. (you can cut the sleeves off just like our model has done, or leave them on). 

*Our model wears large t-shirt

There is very limited number left, only available in Medium and large

name: +1 EP
description:
The first soundmaker release and the first release by Kurtz. A six track ep recorded in the Salon studio, an old victorian toilet in London. Recorded and produced by Adam B Daniels.

Tracks:

1. Drumming
2. Run faster
3. DDD
4. Music Words Text
5. Skyscraper
6. Underneath

name: Kurtz/Woe split
description:
The Kurtz/Woe split 7'' is printed as a limited run of 250 7 inch Vinyl. Artwork by Dominic Beattie and Ralph Fuller. 

Tracks:

Side A

Woe- Ezekiel

Side B

Kurtz- Rhythms & Galleon
